item.title: Zadoff-Chu Sequence
item.description: Properties of Zadoff-chu sequence Constant amplitude Zero autocorrelation Low cross-correlation Low-PAPR sequence generation is 5G NR The low-PAPR sequence $r{\mu,v}^{(\alpha,\delta)}(n)$ is defined by a cyclic shift $\alpha$ of a base sequence $\overline{r}{\mu,v}(n)$ according to $$r{\mu,v}^{(\alpha,\delta)}(n)=e^{j\alpha n}\overline{r}{\mu,v}(n),0\leq n<M_{ZC}$$ $M_{ZC}$ is the length of sequence. Multiple sequences are defined from a single base sequence through different values of $\alpha$ and $\delta$. Base sequences of length 36 or larger Base sequence of length less than 36
